item.title: ‚ÄúEvery 12 hours a woman dies due to complications resulting...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúEvery 12 hours a woman dies due to complications resulting from pregnancy. Additionally, 2 babies die each day. These numbers are disproportionately higher for moms and babies of color,‚Äù wrote Stacey D. Stewart, the group‚Äôs president and CEO, in the report. ‚ÄúNothing sums up the state of the situation that we face in America as well as this one fact: In 2020 the U.S. remains among the most dangerous developed nations for a woman to give birth.‚Äù

Colorado Politics

Twenty-four counties in Colorado have no hospital offering obstetric care or no birth center , according to a new report on ‚Äúmaternity care deserts‚Äù across the country.

coloradopolitics.com

Report: 24 Colorado counties are "maternal care deserts"

Twenty-four counties in Colorado have no hospital offering obstetric care or no birth center , according to a new report on ‚Äúmaternity care deserts‚Äù across the country.Twenty-four counties in Colorado have no hospital offering obstetric care or no birth center , according to a new report on ‚Äúmaternity care deserts‚Äù across the country.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúPeaceful protestors, including state Rep. Leslie Herod, spoke...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúPeaceful protestors, including state Rep. Leslie Herod, spoke out against racial injustice.

‚ÄúWe believe in justice that we have not gotten, and as a Black woman standing in front of you, before this Captiol, we have not done our jobs in there,‚Äù Herod told the crowd.

From Kentucky to Colorado, Herod says there‚Äôs no room for racism in our country. ‚Äú

...

CBS4 Local

See MoreBlack women got together to protest at the Colorado State Capitol Wednesday after learning no officers were charged in the death of Breonna Taylor.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Black Women Protest Peacefully In Denver After Announcement Of No Charges For Officers In Breonna Taylor Death

Black women got together to protest at the Colorado State Capitol Wednesday after learning no officers were charged in the death of Breonna Taylor.Black women got together to protest at the Colorado State Capitol Wednesday after learning no officers were charged in the death of Breonna Taylor.

item.title: ‚ÄúCOVID has been a horrible impact to our country and the...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúCOVID has been a horrible impact to our country and the world. We‚Äôve lost a lot of people,‚Äù said Scott Gilmore, deputy director of Denver Parks & Recreation. ‚ÄúBut it‚Äôs actually also made people really appreciate their parks. It‚Äôs really made people go enjoy the parks in their communities.‚Äù

Denverite

Parks officials are trying to balance a lot of factors, including the fact that not everyone can walk or bike to nature and recreation. They‚Äôll want to hear from you.

denverite.com

The city is taking steps to keep (some) parks (mostly) car-free long after the pandemic is gone

Parks officials are trying to balance a lot of factors, including the fact that not everyone can walk or bike to nature and recreation. They‚Äôll want to hear from you.Parks officials are trying to balance a lot of factors, including the fact that not everyone can walk or bike to nature and recreation. They‚Äôll want to hear from you.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúGatherings of any size among people between the ages of 18...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúGatherings of any size among people between the ages of 18 and 22 are prohibited in the city of Boulder until at least Oct. 8 as public health officials attempt to slow a surge in coronavirus cases linked to the University of Colorado.

An order enacting the mandate goes into effect at 4 p.m. Thursday. Violating the order is a Class 1 misdemeanor and could result in a fine of up to $5,000 and up to 18 months in jail.‚Äù

The Colorado Sun

There have been nearly 1,400 confirmed or probable coronavirus cases among University of Colorado Boulder students since Aug. 24, the first day of the school's fall semester

coloradosun.com

Boulder, seeking to stop coronavirus surge, bans all gatherings among 18 to 22 year olds until Oct. 8

There have been nearly 1,400 confirmed or probable coronavirus cases among University of Colorado Boulder students since Aug. 24, the first day of the school's fall semesterThere have been nearly 1,400 confirmed or probable coronavirus cases among University of Colorado Boulder students since Aug. 24, the first day of the school's fall semester
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúIn Colorado, people are dying at the hands of law...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúIn Colorado, people are dying at the hands of law enforcement,‚Äù Herod said. ‚ÄúIn Colorado, DAs refuse to prosecute murderers. In Denver right now we have a police helicopter circling us instead of circling the murderers of Elijah McClain.‚Äù

‚ÄúSo we fight, and we say we don't want you in our communities to murder us.‚Äù

The Gazette

Hundreds protested in Denver Wednesday night against a grand jury's decision not to charge police officers in connection with Breonna Taylor‚Äôs death.

gazette.com

Coloradans protest no officers charged in Breonna Taylor‚Äôs death (PHOTOS)

Hundreds protested in Denver Wednesday night against a grand jury's decision not to charge police officers in connection with Breonna Taylor‚Äôs death.Hundreds protested in Denver Wednesday night against a grand jury's decision not to charge police officers in connection with Breonna Taylor‚Äôs death.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúPolice officers who kill citizens are rarely convicted. But...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúPolice officers who kill citizens are rarely convicted. But in this tragic situation, in which the woman killed was not only unarmed but asleep in the moments before a police officer took her life, we hoped that for once, justice would be on our side. This is yet another disappointing reminder that it‚Äôs not.‚Äù

No police officer will have to answer for Breonna Taylor‚Äôs death. This never gets easier.

nytimes.com

Opinion | It Hurts to Keep Hoping for Justice

No police officer will have to answer for Breonna Taylor‚Äôs death. This never gets easier.No police officer will have to answer for Breonna Taylor‚Äôs death. This never gets easier.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: Representative Leslie HerodPresident Donald Trump on Wednesday would not commit to providing a peaceful transition of power after Election...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie HerodPresident Donald Trump on Wednesday would not commit to providing a peaceful transition of power after Election Day, lending further fuel to concerns he may not relinquish his office should he lose in November.

cnn.com

Trump refuses to commit to a peaceful transition of power after Election Day

President Donald Trump on Wednesday would not commit to providing a peaceful transition of power after Election Day, lending further fuel to concerns he may not relinquish his office should he lose in November.President Donald Trump on Wednesday would not commit to providing a peaceful transition of power after Election Day, lending further fuel to concerns he may not relinquish his office should he lose in November.Visit the Voting Information Center for election resources and official updates. item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúA grand jury indicted former Louisville police officer Brett...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúA grand jury indicted former Louisville police officer Brett Hankison on three counts of wanton endangerment in the first degree in connection with the fatal shooting of Breonna Taylor in March.

The charges drew immediate criticism from demonstrators who wanted more serious charges, as well as the arrests of the three officers involved.‚Äù

CNN

A grand jury indicted former Louisville police officer Brett Hankison on three counts of wanton endangerment in the first degree in connection with the fatal shooting of Breonna Taylor in March.

cnn.com

Wanton endangerment charge: What it means in the Breonna Taylor case

A grand jury indicted former Louisville police officer Brett Hankison on three counts of wanton endangerment in the first degree in connection with the fatal shooting of Breonna Taylor in March.A grand jury indicted former Louisville police officer Brett Hankison on three counts of wanton endangerment in the first degree in connection with the fatal shooting of Breonna Taylor in March.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúWhat we need to do is make sure that the use of ketamine is...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúWhat we need to do is make sure that the use of ketamine is regulated, and that the regulation and the use is approved in a way that doesn‚Äôt end in the death of people. What we‚Äôve seen through your investigations is that it‚Äôs not just about what‚Äôs happening in Aurora, but quite frankly, there has been instances across the state where the use of ketamine has been abused and has resulted in disastrous consequences for people, including death. We need to change that,‚Äù Herod said."

FOX31 KDVR.com

DENVER (KDVR) ‚Äî The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment (CDPHE) is not revealing the status of its review of a state waiver program that allows paramedics to administer ketam‚Ä¶

Health department stays mum on whether ketamine review has begun, one month after announcement

item.title: ‚ÄúStarting this October, Denverites will have a chance to see...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúStarting this October, Denverites will have a chance to see the works of Frida Kahlo, Diego Rivera and other Mexican modernist artists in person. From October 25 through January 24, a new Mexican art exhibition will take over a wing of the Denver Art Museum.‚Äù

Denverite

Tickets go on sale in October.

item.title: Representative Leslie HerodColorado Democratic Party was live.September 22nd is National Voter Registration Day and voting in Colorado...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie HerodColorado Democratic Party was live.

September 22nd is National Voter Registration Day and voting in Colorado starts in less than a month!

Join Biden for President, our future 2nd Gentleman DOUG EM...HOFF, singer-songwriter GRACIE ABRAMS, Colorado's Secretary of State Jena Griswold, and Representative Dylan Roberts and Representative Leslie Herod to celebrate our right to vote, learn how to make sure you're registered and ready to vote, and make sure your friends are doing the same!

The numbers are clear: when young folks show up, we make the difference!

See MoreVisit the Voting Information Center for election resources and official updates. Get Voting Information
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúBillionaire Mike Bloomberg has paid off $20million in debt...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúBillionaire Mike Bloomberg has paid off $20million in debt for more than 31,000 felons in Florida so that they can vote in the state where just 537 votes decided the presidential election in 2000.‚Äù

Billionaire Mike Bloomberg has paid off $20million in debt for more than 31,000 felons in Florida so that they can vote in the state where just 537 votes decided the presidential election in 2000.

item.title: ‚ÄúColorado is facing one of the most challenging economic...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúColorado is facing one of the most challenging economic crises in our history, and public agencies are facing difficult budget constraints,‚Äù Gov. Jared Polis said in a news release. ‚ÄúJust as the private sector is tightening its belt, so too must the government. This thoughtful furlough plan helps address the state‚Äôs budget shortfall while ensuring that our lower wage workers are not impacted and we can continue to deliver high quality critical services for Coloradans.‚Äù

The Denver Post

Most state employees who make more than $50,000 annually will be taking up to four furlough days before the end of the fiscal year, the governor‚Äôs office announced Tuesday.

denverpost.com

Colorado governor will require furloughs for state workers ‚Äì including himself

Most state employees who make more than $50,000 annually will be taking up to four furlough days before the end of the fiscal year, the governor‚Äôs office announced Tuesday.Most state employees who make more than $50,000 annually will be taking up to four furlough days before the end of the fiscal year, the governor‚Äôs office announced Tuesday.

item.title: ‚ÄúThese two elected prosecutors, Young a Democrat and Brauchler...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúThese two elected prosecutors, Young a Democrat and Brauchler a Republican, overlooked several critical issues.

First, they failed to appreciate that they are as much of the problem as are police regarding a dearth of justice for people, mostly Black people, mistreated and sometimes wrongly killed by Aurora officers.‚Äù

Many of the recent Aurora protests focus on the dearth of credibility police and prosecutors have in ‚Äúself-policing.‚Äù Aggrandized charges by these two district attorneys only fuel that controversy, further undermining their critical agencies.

sentinelcolorado.com

EDITORIAL: DAs Young and Brauchler bungle charges against Elijah McClain protesters - Sentinel Colorado

Many of the recent Aurora protests focus on the dearth of credibility police and prosecutors have in ‚Äúself-policing.‚Äù Aggrandized charges by these two district attorneys only fuel that controversy, further undermining their critical agencies.Many of the recent Aurora protests focus on the dearth of credibility police and prosecutors have in ‚Äúself-policing.‚Äù Aggrandized charges by these two district attorneys only fuel that controversy, further undermining their critical agencies.

item.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.‚Äù

- 5280 Magazine

...

Styling: LILFRESHSAM
